alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 11:35AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...The Yukon and Porcupine River at Fort Yukon * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...The runway remains cutoff from the terminal due to water over the ramp and planes are unable to taxi to the terminal. High water is impacting the road by the Voc-Ed building and flooding portions of 4th, 6th, and 7th Ave. Several residences in low-lying areas have flooded. There is also water around the north end of the runway. The road east of the Tribal Hall has been breached to reduce water levels and allow water to flow back towards the Yukon River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - As of 11:30 AM AKDT Friday, water levels are steady on the Porcupine and are now dropping on the Upper Yukon at Dawson and Eagle. Water levels are currently steady in Fort Yukon but are expected to slowly recede over the weekend into the next week. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Yukon or Porcupine River at Fort Yukon stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
